segment.source: Flash MMOS to the device
segment.target: Flash MMOS to the device

segment.source: Flash MMOS to the device
segment.target: Flash MMOS to the device

segment.source: Flash MMOS to the device
segment.target: Flash MMOS to the device

segment.source: After the MMOS image definition is complete, the image can be flashed to the device
segment.target: After the MMOS image definition is complete, the image can be flashed to the device

segment.source: Flashing on the host side is accomplished through a connection established with WinUSB, the Microsoft generic USB device driver.
segment.target: Flashing on the host side is accomplished through a connection established with WinUSB, the Microsoft generic USB device driver.

segment.source: The necessary drivers are included by default in Windows 8 and Windows 10.
segment.target: The necessary drivers are included by default in Windows 8 and Windows 10.

segment.source: In Windows 7, the necessary drivers can be installed from Windows Update.
segment.target: In Windows 7, the necessary drivers can be installed from Windows Update.

segment.source: To configure a Windows 7 computer to install the necessary drivers, click Start, type “Device Installation Settings”, select Yes, do this automatically (recommended), and then click Save Changes.
segment.target: To configure a Windows 7 computer to install the necessary drivers, click Start, type “Device Installation Settings”, select Yes, do this automatically (recommended), and then click Save Changes.

segment.source: Put the device in flashing mode by holding the volume up button while powering up the device.
segment.target: Put the device in flashing mode by holding the volume up button while powering up the device.

segment.source: After the device is in flashing mode, connect the USB cable to your computer.
segment.target: After the device is in flashing mode, connect the USB cable to your computer.

segment.source: Verify that the device is detected in Device Manager as WinUsb Device.
segment.target: Verify that the device is detected in Device Manager as WinUsb Device.

segment.source: To be able to use the ffutool, sign, and ImageSigner tools, add %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386 to your environment Path variable.
segment.target: To be able to use the ffutool, sign, and ImageSigner tools, add %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386 to your environment Path variable.

segment.source: Prior to flashing the FFU file to the device, you must sign the FFU file using the following syntax in the command prompt.
segment.target: Prior to flashing the FFU file to the device, you must sign the FFU file using the following syntax in the command prompt.

segment.source: The cat file is generated with the FFU, when using the ImgGen tool.
segment.target: The cat file is generated with the FFU, when using the ImgGen tool.

segment.target: You should see output similar to the following.

segment.source: The device will reboot into MMOS.
segment.target: The device will reboot into MMOS.

segment.source: The display on the device will show a small rotating graphic.
segment.target: The display on the device will show a small rotating graphic.
